author: Andy Pasztor
title: Why the Pentagon Got Just One Bid to Build Next-Generation GPS Satellites
text:
Lockheed Martin Corp. will remain the sole producer of satellites for the governmentâ€™s Global Positioning System after two main rivals decided against bidding on the newest version, reflecting new Air Force acquisition strategies that favor incumbent contractors on some big-ticket space programs.
The decisions by Boeing Co. and Northrop Grumman Corp. this month to forgo competing for the multibillion-dollar business are in keeping with efforts by Air Force brass to reduce long-term costs and accelerate production of GPS... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
